page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: There are several features of ecological interest in the landscape between Kinglassie and Auchterderran. 1. A{rookery}is to be found in the grounds of Kinglassie House. 2. One of the boundary hedges beside Craigside Plantation is a{hornbeam} {hedge.}This type of hedge is native to south east England and it is unusual to find such a hedge in Scotland. 3. A locality in this area was confirmed in 1983 as the only recorded site in Scotland of the{Great {Crested Newt. 4.{The Lochty Burn}is severely {polluted with ferruginous waste}from the Westfield Coal Mining Complex. This gives the water in the burn a red colour and the water is void of any life.
